body.description: Features: Supported operating systems: Windows10/ 8/7 / Vista / XP / CE VK-172 baud rate automatically adapt to any baud data output Supported Google Earth Ublox 7020 chip Please contact us for the driver before use it, Please use it outside if it can not get the satellites Specification: Supported operating systems: Windows 10/8/7/Vista/XP/CE Support Google Earth C / A code, 1.023MHz stream Receive Band: L1 [1575.42MHz] Tracking Channels: 56 Support DGPS [WAAS, EGNOS and MSAS] Positioning performance: 2D plane: 5m [average] 2D plane: 3.5m [average], has DGPS auxiliary. Drift: <0.02m / s Timing Accuracy: 1us Reference coordinate system: WGS-84 Maximum altitude: 18,000 m Maximum speed: 500m / s Acceleration: <4g Electrical properties: Tracking sensitivity:-162dBm Acquisition sensitivity:-160dBm Cold Start Time: 29s [average] Warm start time: 28s [average] Hot start time: 1s [average] Recapture Time: 0.1s [average] Operating temperature: -30 to +80 Packing includes: 1* VK172 G-MOUSE USB GPS/GLONASS USB GPS Receiver

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Great GPS Dongle for Most GPS-Aware Apps
reviews.reviewText: As an Amateur Radio Operator (Ham Radio), location reporting is very useful as we support public events, search & rescue, disaster response, etc. This wonderful little dongle makes position reporting simple and easy. Based on my personal use, it works on Apple IOS (MacBook Pro 2015) and on Windows 10 (a virtual machine running via Parallels Software on my MacBook). I have also used it with other Apple & Windows, GPS-aware apps, and everything seems to get along and work fine.Just be aware that this dongle provides GPS information only. What you can do with that data is up to you and other apps you may have that can use GPS data. No software is provided with this dongle...it is intended to simply be a source of GPS data.When used with GPS-aware apps like Winlink (ham radio software that allows emails to be sent/received via the Internet and via radio signals), position reporting is super simple with this little dongle. GPS coordinates are acquired then other apps like Winlink pass them along to other location tracking software and apps like APRS.fi. This dongle opens up a world of capabilities. It also seems to work well even in interior environments (as within our home) so don't let the small size fool you. It does work.For the money and small size, this is a great inexpensive investment in GPS technology that has practical real-world uses.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works on Apple IOS (Monterey)
reviews.reviewText: This fob worked straight out of the box without any need to install new drivers. I’m running Open CPN marine navigation software on a 2015 MacBook Air 13” with MacOS 12.6.4 operating system. The software recognize the fob in a serial source search and once connected at 38400, it started providing NMEA positioning data. The fob also did a great job quickly acquiring satellites indoors.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works with Mac OS! GPS or GLONASS but not simultaneous. 10Hz possible.
reviews.reviewText: This is a great little GPS receiver for the money. It's based on the u-blox 7 chipset. I have it working on a Mac and Windows. I think it's compatible with the FTDI drivers that I already had installed for USB to serial adapters, because I didn't have to download a driver on either OS. On Mac, it showed up as /dev/cu/usbmodem14201. It worked perfectly with "GPS Dashboard" from the Mac App Store. On Windows, you can access it through a standard COM port. By default, the device was set up for the GPS satellites, and starts sending out NMEA messages when the serial port is opened.To configure its settings, you can use the U-Center eval software (only for Windows) from u-Blox. On the View-Configuration menu you can change the options. You can enable GLONASS but you have to uncheck the GPS and SBAS types, otherwise it won't accept the changes. Either GPS or GLONASS can be selected, but not simultaneously. Note that it goes back to GPS when power is lost unless you save the configuration to the device NVRAM. The options for Beidou and Galileo are greyed out, so I don't think it works with those - even though the package insert says "Galileo".With GPS, it outputs NMEA strings starting with $GP.... and with GLONASS it outputs strings starting with $GL...Using the GLONASS, it takes longer to lock on to satellites. Maybe gets 5 sats total. GPS will lock onto 8 to 10 in the same spot. I can use it in GPS mode indoors but GLONASS is hit or miss.Bonus: you can configure this for 10Hz output in the rate settings. But I also bumped up the baud rate to 19200.All in all, a pretty cool little receiver!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars I must have received a defective unit
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the HiLetgo VK172 G-Mouse USB GPS/GLONASS USB GPS Receiver for Windows 10/8/7/VISTA/XP after reading the reviews. Some reviews report success using it on Windows 10, other reviews said it does not work.I find the unit I received in the "does not work" category. I have a small customer with a production network that must remain isolated from the Internet. The VK172 (from reviews) looked promising to provide a GPS Time based standard to be used to sync all PCs on the network. The unit was recognized by Windows 10 professional 21H2 as USB serial device when I connected it. I used Putty to make a serial connection to the device and see NMEA output. Unfortunately, the output is incomplete and not recognized by any GPS software that I could find and download, or any web site offering NMEA decoding.Other reviewers of this device recommended BktTimeSync to sync the Windows PC clock to the GPS time received from the VK172. BktTimeSync version 1.11.3 did not work with this device. The device did not work with Google Earth.A program named NMEATimePanel was able to decode the time from the VK172 but did not show Latitude, Longitude, or Altitude and the status continued to display "searching."Watching some of the YouTube videos show the device LED flashing green. The unit I received never changed from solid red.I ordered two other units that both worked without drivers: VK-162 G-Mouse USB GPS Dongle, and USB GPS Receiver Antenna Gmouse for Laptop PC Car Marine Navigation/Stratux/Raspberry Pi.Both worked with BktTimeSync and when paired with Meinberg NTP package version 4.2.8p15 provided a functional GPS time based Stratum 2 NTP server for the network.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good little GPS.
reviews.reviewText: Mine works great. Great price too. I use it for Ham Radio applications and it works great. Keep in mind these are made in China so occasionally you may get hold of a bad one. Out of two I ordered outside of Amazon 1 was bad. You get what you pay for.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect size for ADs-B receiver project
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this as part of an ADS-B receiver kit
商品が早く届いたし、使いやすかったです。
